p: Similar to the carpological record, pollen concentrations remain consistently high up to the YDB layer, after which there is a dramatic and immediate decrease in abundance and diversity (species richness and Shannon index), along with a significant shift in taxonomic composition (vegetation turnover index) (Figs 4j and 13; Supplementary Table S12). A summary of the vegetation history and environmental/climatic interpretations for Pilauco and other regional sites is presented in Supplementary Table S13.
